title: Mexican President to Name Finance Minister Arturo Herrera as Next Bank of Mexico Governor
sub_head: ‘We want to maintain macroeconomic stability,’ president says
body:
Mexico’s Finance Minister Arturo Herrera will be named as the next head of the country’s central bank, replacing Alejandro Díaz de León when his term finishes at the end of December, Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador said Wednesday.
Mr. Herrera will be replaced at the finance ministry by Rogelio Ramírez de la O, a longtime economic adviser to Mr. López Obrador.
